entries.trait: I idolize a particular hero of my faith and constantly refer to that person's deeds and example.
I can find common ground between the fiercest enemies, empowering them to work together.
I see omens in every event and action.
Nothing can shake my optimistic attitude.
I quote sacred texts and proverbs in almost every situation.
I am tolerant of other faiths and respect the worship of other gods.
I've enjoyed fine food, drink, and high society. Rough living grates on me.
I always have a plan for what to do when things go wrong.
I am always calm, no matter what the situation. I never raise my voice or let my emotions control me.
I am incredibly slow to trust. Those who seem the fairest often have the most to hide.
I would rather make a new friend than a new enemy.
I'm driven by a wanderlust that led me away from home.
I judge people by their actions, not their words.
If someone is in trouble, I'm always ready to lend help.
When I set my mind to something, I follow through no matter what gets in my way.
I have a crude sense of humor.
I pocket anything I see that might have some value.
I blow up at the slightest insult.
I turn tail and run when things look bad.
I am dogmatic in my thoughts and philosophy.
I put too much trust in those who wield power within my institution.
I'm convinced that people are always trying to steal my secrets.
I speak without really thinking through my words, invariably insulting others.

entries.description: I trust that my deity will guide my actions. I have faith that if I work hard, things will go well.
The ancient traditions of worship and sacrifice must be preserved and upheld.
I always try to help those in need, no matter what the personal cost.
We must help bring about the changes the gods are constantly working in the world.
I hope to one day rise to the top of my faith's religious hierarchy.
The path to power and self-improvement is through knowledge.
Everyone should be free to pursue their own livelihood.
The strongest are meant to rule.
I don't steal from others in the trade.
I never target people who can't afford to lose a few coins.
There's no good pretending to be something I'm not.
My gifts are meant to be shared with all, not used for my own benefit.
Emotions must not cloud our sense of what is right and true, or our logical thinking.
What is beautiful points us beyond itself toward what is true.
I work hard to be the best there is at my craft.

entries.bond: I would die to recover an ancient relic that was lost long ago.
I will someday get revenge on the corrupt power that destroyed my family.
I owe my life to the priest who took me in when my parents died.
maps_to: shaped by a single person's kindness

entries.bond: Everything I do is for the common people.
I will do anything to protect the temple where I served.
I seek to preserve a work of art, or a sacred text, that holds great importance.
I'm trying to pay off an old debt I owe to a generous benefactor.
My tools are symbols of my past life, and I carry them so I never forget my roots.
I protect those who cannot protect themselves.
My loyalty to my sovereign is unwavering.
Someone I loved died because of a mistake I made. That will never happen again.

entries.flaw: I judge others harshly, and myself even more severely.
I put too much trust in those who wield power within my institution.
My piety sometimes leads me to blindly trust those that profess faith in my god.
maps_to: vulnerable to manipulation by those who share values

entries.flaw: I am inflexible in my thinking.
I am suspicious of strangers and expect the worst of people.
Once I pick a goal, I become obsessed with it to the detriment of everything else.
I have trouble keeping my true feelings hidden. My sharp tongue lands me in trouble.
I'd rather eat my armor than admit when I'm wrong.
I have a weakness for the vices of the city, especially hard drink.
Secretly, I believe that things would be better if I were in charge of everything.
I have trouble trusting in my allies.
I'll do anything to win fame and renown.
I'm never satisfied with what I haveâ€”I always want more.
I overlook obvious solutions in favor of complicated ones.
